review_title: Still Good, even to this day
one_reviews_text: One of the reasons I originally got this game was because it ran really well on older hardware. I have a computer with an i5 4670, 16gb ddr3 ram, and a gtx 1650 super, and it runs INCREDIBLY smoothly on my Quest 2 via link cable. The storyline is kinda short, but it is really good, with some major plot twists. Honestly a better storyline than most recent DC movies. I just wish it was longer and that there was more interaction with the game. If this game was remade to the modern VR standards, it would me amazing.
Rocksteady really needs to come out with another VR game my only complaints are is it isn't long and definitely leaves the player wanting more
It was a alright game but short it only lasted it for 5 minutes not worth spending the money.

review_title: One more of those 0.5 GBP / min game
one_reviews_text: I mean, yeah, i'm done with the game... Play time: 42 minutes. Wasn't too bad, wasn't too good either. The story just... stops at some point and you get a final credits... and you feel like "here is another 20 quids i'm not seeing again..."

NO SPOILERS


Wow, so many people bomb this game....and for what?

1- gameplay
Pros
I ran this game really smoothly on my quest 1 connected to my pc, no problems, no jankiness, easily adjustable graphics in the games menu that actually make sense
Gameplay with controllers makes sense, works perfectly, the system with the utility belt holding gadgets is great
In the segment where Robin is talking to you, he doesn’t look too cartoonish, or lag the game at all
Solving riddler riddles and trophies is just the right amount of challenging
Cons
No fighting mechanics
Only three main items you use to interact with things, although the forensic scanner is multi use

2- story
Pros
The story is phenomenal if you know the Arkham games. If you don’t, look up their stories or try the game trilogy yourself, it’s a masterpiece. It’s a dream sequence (not really a spoiler you’ll know when you play it almost right away) feels like a bad lsd trip in a good way, and gets the job done. Perfect.
Cons
Honestly I don’t have any, keeps you on the edge of your seat the whole time


3- addressing the main problems 
Yes, this game could be longer. But it ends on a great place, and the detail......blew me away. The attention to streak marks from a mop on the floor, light shading, a fully playable piano with sheet music that ties to the game, subtle hints, including many trophies you can get, and SO much detail. I have played many games, and yes, this one is short, but wow I have never seen a game where creators bothered with this much accuracy and detail, down to rendering so many things they didn’t even need too. Yes, there isn’t combat. But this game focuses more on the detective side of Batman with amazing precision and great story beats. Also, the collectibles are awesome. 


Overall-
10/10
Really, if you’re an Arkham fan, do it
This is a fun little game, feels like a demo. It is definitely not worth paying more than $5.00 for it. Hopefully this is just a taste of more to come.

review_title: game at one dollar per minute
one_reviews_text: game at one dollar per minute of playing time. the price does not shorten your playing time.

I purchase your app for my Rift, works great.  I replaced my Rift with a new Quest 2. it is mental to think someone is going to repurchase your app for a newer hardware, but same system (Facebook). I refuse to purchase it again due to newer version of the quest 2 I have. I would like my purchase moved to my lol same Facebook account under my quest 2. BTW I had to replace my rift due to Oculus not supporting the purchase of new Headset cables.
I thought the game was really cool. The ending of the game really got my attention and really cool! But the story at the end made no sense......Great game....lowsy story...
its a very short game its realy just a demo but sum parts make up for it like the bit with  killer crock  its price should be low not high
This is the shortest game ever It makes me so furios because of what I payed DONT BUY ITS A SCAM.

review_title: The VR is nice, but is way too short
one_reviews_text: I liked the game, but as the story started getting going it just ends. For 20 dollars I wasn’t expecting just a small chapter. Even though they break it up into three acts. Not worth the money but fun.

the vr is super immersive and detailed. the world feels so fleshed out and dark and the story is exciting with a crazy twist! If youre the kind of person who thinks all a video game is is fighting this isnt for you. There isnt much fighting its about the world and being present. It really felt like i was in there!

When I saw arkham in this title I assumed it would be a tactical stealth takedown game with a detective aspect to it. Instead I got the most non-immersive game I've ever played. I've dreamed about being Batman and taking down enemies with brute force martial arts. There is 0 fighting in this game entirely. The fight scene is just trowing like 3 batarangs and when you use a grappling hook, the screen turns black and you appear at the spot you grappled. This game was a major disappointment and upsetting to be called an Arkham game.
wtf is a batman game without fighting ???????????????????????????

Maybe this isn't for gamers or intense DC fanboys, but I personally loved this game. The amount of detail in this world is so surreal (from Bruce's bloody hands, to the batmobile, to his gadgets, to being able to stick your face right in Nightwing's). True, it was only a 1hr experience, but from beginning to end my mouth was open in awe like a kid in a toy store. Don't buy it expecting challenging gameplay or a true-to-the-comics storyline. I bought it because I wanted to experience a world that meant so much to me ever since I was a kid. For me, it did that and more. Hope there are more experiences like this being developped!

So, I found this game to be somewhat dissapointing as a VR game. It took me about an hour to beat, which I find somewhat lacking for a $20 game. There are these challenges you can do after (finding clues in the campaign), which I haven't done (and personally, I really disliked the plot). Also, after completing the game, I have to say that the trailer for this game is very misleading. You aren't fighting bad guys, flying around, or even driving anywhere; its mostly just solving clues and looking around. But what I found really bad was that this game lacks certain basic VR functions that I like to see in VR games, which includes the following:
-You cannot move with the touch controllers, you "teleport" to certain spots using A.
-You cannot look around (looking left and right) with the touch controllers, you have to turn physically.
-There is no option to reset the view.
I have a small space to use my VR, but this isn't a problem if you have a bigger space for your VR (and possibly more sensors). The only good thing I have to say about this game is that they do an okay job at immersing you into the world of Gotham City, and the graphics and sounds are pretty accurate, but I feel overall, this game really isn't worth the money.
Game crashes anywhere between 5 to 15 minutes in.  Playing using Oculus Quest Link with AMD RX 580. Very disappointing to waste money on something you cant play. :(

(Would have been 3.5 stars, but that's not available)
I've been a Batman fan for a while now, and an Arkham fan for a few years now, having finished Origins, Asylum and City.  And because of this it was truly a great experience due to the true-to-self Arkham style and pure immersion.  It is obviously quite short with gameplay lasting only about two-hours if you were to be taking your time (as I did), though rushing through would likely be closer to an hour.  However, I don't hold this against, the developers as VR games generally have a high-cost to make with a comparitively small price-tag.  
Pros:
-Excellent graphics, I loved how Wayne's bare hands were even visibly bruised.  
-Fantastic attention to detail, from the vehicles to characters, the environment and beyond.  
-Feels familiar.  Actually felt like the Arkham universe, with familiar environments, gadgets, features, characters and grit that the series is known for.  
-Decent playtime for the completionist.  Now, I know that many people who play won't bother finishing the Riddler challenges, but I am currently only four challenges away from completion.  This increases playtime from one-hour to almost five, which is a huge plus.  
-Decent story.  The story was decent, although somewhat disappointing when coming upon the revelation from the final level.  

Cons:
-Some control issues.  The Batarang Riddler challenge is OBSCENELY hard, as the auto-aim only works below a certain height--meaning if you are throwing at a high-up target, good luck, as you will only have the janky throwing mechanics to use.  
-Puzzles were generally too simple.  Would have preferred much more advanced and common use of the grapple gun and batarangs.  Perhaps the addition of other simple gadgets, such as the cryo grenade would have made the puzzles more elaborate.  
-And finally, too short with too few mechanics.  Each major feature (crime-scene reconstruction, object reconstruction, Batwing takedown, etc.) was used only only once.

Buy it on sale, but not for full price. Its not worth the full price. Thank god i found this game on a sale and didn't buy it for the full price :)

The game is ok but its to short...
The graphics are super but that's about it. You can't fight, you can't drive vehicles. Full price I would not recommend it to anyone !!
Love the amazing quality and detail! One of the best I've seen, but several times I found a bug where it goes to black and white and I lose my controllers at the same time... have to reboot.
review_feedback: Hey Ron! Sorry to hear you ran into this. We'd love to get more details about the issue you encountered where you needed to reboot. Can you please put in a report at https://go.wbgames.com/DChelp so we can review? Thanks!

one_reviews_text: What a waste of money.

Honestly this is a demo, no more no less.
A quest game where you visit several single scenes moving by storyline. Every scene has several fixed positions you may switch between to solve puzzles or doing some actions. You got few devices you may use in scenes to complete missions.
You can't free walk around or interact with objects that don't belong to current main quest or side quests. Nevertheless immersive is good, story intrique and you have some sudden situations make you heart beats faster. 
And traditional riddler pazzles of course! But after completing main story ;)
+++
- Excellent Gotham atmosphere
- Descent graphics
- Strong game base
- Fun quests and puzzles
- Great music and sound
- Intuitive interface

- - -
- Poor touch pads implementing
- Almost zero interactive
- The game seems to be a demo
- Many in-gamethings/active surroundings have no use (seems to be prepared for full version)
- To short
- To short
- And again TOO short

Resume: the game is good enough for demo, but not for finished product. It seems to be discontinued (game site is down) so it's not like we get some more batman stories nearest future. You may have good enough experience for two hours or so completing main storyline (or much more if you decide to get achievements and solve riddler puzzles) still, but i'm not sure the price for this game could be more than 10 bucks max so i can recommend wait discount.

Blew me away! Like stepping into the Batman universe. Absolutely mandatory to own if u have VR. Graphics are amazing. One of my favorite puirchases next to Vader. Runs great on my AMD FX 9590 @ 5.08ghz, 16GB DDR3, 1080 GTX 8GB.

Really enjoyed this title. The graphics look amazing and the story draws you in leaving you wanting more. My favorite moment is at the end during the prison scene. No spoilers …. You really do feel like the Batman :P

Now a few Cons: It’s not a game, it feels more like an experience rather than a full fledge title. Which is okay but it should be advertised as such. Also, the vehicles … sorry you never get to drive or pilot any of those, sort of a letdown; Would have liked to experience that. 

Lastly and this is what bothered me the most was the tracking notification tringle that kelp popping up in the middle of my visor. My controllers are fine and track well with my other games but seems to have an issue with this title. I keep having to bring my hands in front of my face to make this annoying warning go away.

Still I'm looking forward for the next chapter in this adventure.
Excellent demo, but it's not long enough nor immersive enough to be considered a game. I'm actually furious that I spent £18 on this.

review_title: Dvp, can you finish the game please ?
one_reviews_text:
It's so short it looks like a demo. !

Graphics are good, story is OK, but you only do the first 3 chapter of a longer story plot. 

EDIT : 
It's really frustrating. The experience is immersive enough and the puzzles are fun to solves. I really wish it had some action in it. It could be one of the best game (the universe and the details are really good)

Imagine the same game + battle + car and air travel and few creative actions including hand/body movement...
It takes forever and keeps pausing for me

Great graphics, great voice acting (Mark Hamill is always epic as the Joker), and that's it.  The gameplay in itself is beyond dull, absolutely zero action.  Don't get this game expecting to feel superheroic while playing it; the level of inaction for a Batman game is ludicrous.  Even though Alfred gives you the choice between the Batmobile and the Batwing, the devs are so scared to make someone sick that you won't even get to sit in those vehicles.  The guys that made this and Marvel Powers United should go play Windlands 2.

This was a tough one to review.  It was quite a good 30-45 minute experience, great voice acting, graphics, story, and WOW what a plot twist ending.  But for the price judge for yourself if 30 minutes is worth it.

review_title: Great graphics, decent story, too short
one_reviews_text:
This game is only like one hour. Such a shame, as it has so much potential. Don't get me wrong, it's a fantastic one hour. But you wouldn't wanna play it again. The graphics will amaze you, especially when you go into the Batcave. Also beware, the size of everything will terrify you, especially if you've played the previous games in the series, as everything seems much smaller there. The story is really well thought out, and is canon to the other games which aren't VR, which is pretty cool. But a second negative is you don't actually get to see when you go in the Batmobile or the Batwing, but that actually makes sense why if you go deep to figure out the deeper story (I'm trying not to spoil it).
EDIT: Oh by the way that "one hour" of gameplay doesn't include the Riddler challenges (yes, they're still annoying like in the previous games, and yes, they're almost impossible).

There is really not much to this game other than enjoying the graphics and the basic story. But it does do it very well. If this game had been a little more open and laster longer than an hour it would have gotten 5 star.  But for what you pay this game is very much lacking and feels more like something that should have been given away for free to promote a new movie or something.

I have a CPU ryzen 5, 8GB, NVIDIA 1070 and all the updated software, however the game never booted. I tried to correct the game, including with many tickets with the Oculus Support but I gave up, I only have to comment.
review_feedback: Sorry to hear you're having issues getting the game to boot! If you haven't, make sure to put in a ticket at go.wbgames.com/DChelp and we'll look into it for you!

one_reviews_text: too short of game works great I like playing full Batman games on pc, xbox one x

This game was amazing. I was so immersed throughout the entire experience and got some chills down my spine during some off settling parts. The game is built on a kind of Escape Room esque type of gameplay where you find clues and try to solve relatively easy puzzles with your tools. 

A lot of people are complaining that it's too short. I was able to get through the game in about an hour and a half while making sure to try to see all the details that were put into the game. Regardless of the game only being about an hour or two hours, it was amazing all the way through. They integrated the concepts of virtual reality super well and I am definitely going to use this game as a demo to friends in order to show what virtual reality is capable of.

I really liked this. It was not a long game but it was worthwhile given the high quality of the graphics. Maybe next segment they'll have added another device or two on the utility belt. Just having the bio scanner, batarang and grappler was sufficient here but it felt like something was missing sometimes in the way of devices. Small point, though. All in all a short but excellent game. Hope there's a sequel.

review_title: not a game, its a demo
one_reviews_text: gameplay is under 1 hour even when taking your time, the combat is non existant, you basically are doing busy "detective" work, im so sick of VR developers being lazy and thinking the VR experience will carry the weightlessness of their content, not even worth it when on sale for $5
good game but short and i would like a lot more missions to do in the game instead of the same one over and over again

I only paid 5 bucks for this game, and it was truly amazing. In summer 2018 the graphics are still among the most impressive on the Rift. I cranked up super-sampling to 2.0 and the game performed flawlessly (90 fps) on an oc'ed 1080. Note that this is a short adventure game, so do not expect an action game. Take your time to enjoy all scenes and you may have about 1 hour of great content.

I hate it when VR developers love putting jump scares into their game! It's like the cheapest way to get a reaction out of players and it totally destroyed my mood! I was aware of how short the game was from the reviews before I bought it but I never thought it was this short! The whole thing ended in what felt like less than half-hour to me. It's not even a game, it's just a demo in the form of a tutorial! You don't really have any choices and you won't need any skills either. Just follow the instructions to the "ending" where nothing is concluded! How can they publish and SELL a "game " that is just a tutorial? I feel bad for those who paid full price! I'm not happy paying $4.99 either! Granted the graphics and mechanics are great, but that is if you make it into a game. This is just a short demo and they should only charge full price after they made it into a full game. I'm just really disappointed. It has so much potential but for now it's just a cash-grab. I hope they make a part-2 and be actually worth the money this time. 1-star for the short demo with all the cheap jump-scares and 1 more star for the graphics and engine.

review_title: Probably not the batman you wanted...
one_reviews_text:
The only reason this gets a 4/5 is because the graphics were so phenomenal. 
This is worth 9.99 but not 19.99 -- better to wait for it to go on sale if interested.

review_title: Great... but short shor sho sh s done !!

review_title: For 5 euro it was a nice experience
one_reviews_text:
Almost didn't buy, even at 5 euro, due to the 1 star ratings.
However this experience is high quality, especially graphics wise, with some nice surprises but quite short in length.
I can imagine people rating it low when bought at full price, but at this discount price it is enjoyable and worth it imho.

I loved it! The game is an adventure not an action game. Technically the game is one of best in VR. Graphics are AMAZING, so is every feature or mechanic the game has. You really need to take a close look at those beautifully made character faces! I didnt really found anything in game that was sloppy or badly created. The story was twisted as it should be for a game about joker. Just terrifying with lot of dose of crazyness. But it is short! For some weird reason the devs created lots of good features for a full game but didnt bother to create content. Really bad decision from the devs. At least the game has LOTS of secrets that you wont find easy, so if you are playing it in a hurry it will be even shorter! So take your time and examine everything. I highly recommend it for a price lower than 10 euros

I'm sad that you didnt get to fight any bad guys or drive the vehicles. Like the game would be awesome if there was actual gameplay. Where is the game play? this is more like an interactive short film. please add fighting and driving.

This game is well done. Lots of details and smart use of the VR system.

I enjoyed playing it, though it is a short play.
All in all it looks pretty awesome and has beautiful locations. It could be much better if there where a batmobile ride included. Theres more potential in it, so only 3 stars.
really short, kinda clunky.
You feel like your feet are in ciment block

I finished it in an hour. Just great atmosphere and mechanics made sense. I loved it that it was more of a puzzle game than action. Couple of nice scares too. Only 4 stars because it was short and I want MORE.

review_title: Great game, just not enough play time
one_reviews_text:
This is a grat game, its very immersive, the minute you put on the batman mask and see your reflection the inner child is delighted. The gameplay is good, graphics rock, but just as you think you are getting ready for your first boss battle it enters a 360 cutscene deneaument and rolls credits. Personally I found I felt cheated financially as there was nowhere near enough gameplay in this to warrant the AAAtitle price I paid for this at its release, sadly its been too long a time between me buying it and getting time to play through it to be able to apply for a refund. I would probably buy the next installment in the franchise, but I'd be wary of reading reviews to see how long the campaign is before commiting to the decision.

Great game, 3 stars because it feels incomplete.  When you enter a vehicle, screen is black until you reach your destination, transitions between custscenes are instant and movement between points is instant.  The game also feels a bit too scripted, almost like a movie with little player interaction needed.

not 20$ worth because it too short

This is a amazing tech demo prob the best out there, graphics are best out for the rift, wish they would make this into a full game, loved every minute brilliant experiance.
way way better than ithoght

review_title: Easily the best VR game yet
one_reviews_text:
Batman : Arkham VR is a masterpiece. I know many people will argue : "this is just a demo", "the gameplay is empty", "we can't move freely".
All those complaints are true. Overall the game takes two to five hours to complete (depending on whether you'll rush it or explore and search the various Easter Eggs hidden around the different areas).
But despite the lack of actual gameplay, this game still offers among the best graphics for a VR game (obviously : this is Arkham after all!). Whether that be the textures, the models, or the reflection of the light, EVERYTHING is perfect visually speaking.
Sadly, there is close to no music at all, this is kind of a let down for me as the Arkham games usually offer us great tracks.
But a game, today, it's not just the technical aspect : it's also an atmosphere, and a scenario.
For the atmosphere, there is no argue here : we are definitely back in the Arkham saga. Everything is so grim! 
Story-wise, this is great but you have to know the Arkham games if you want to apprehend it. Indeed, Arkham:VR is tightly related to the other games! And, as nothing is easy for The Bat, nothing is explicitely said : you have to figure out by yourself what is happening, and when this game actually occurs in the Arkham timeline.
Besides, despite the few number of sequences, many of them are so enjoyable : whether that be the investigation on the crime scene in Gotham Streets, the inspection of dead bodies in the morgue, or the final act after the sewers, really, I don't regret playing this.

Finally, the puzzles were awesome. Some will argue that the game was easy ; I'll answer them "how about you try decyphering the mystic radio message, by yourself? If you found it, that is...".
So, in the end, this is Arkham VR : a poor gameplay (we can't move freely, and there is close to nothing to do, as the number of gadgets and their usefulness are limited), but a great story in a great environment. Definitely worth the price!

The short experience and bare-bones gameplay is not much of an issue, because you literally are the Batman. This is one of those satisfying tech demos, that oozes quality, and tells you what the future of gaming could be like. If you could actually do some brawling in this, like the Arkham games, and had puzzles and a wider variety of missions, this could have been the best VR game out there. Too short and simple though.

As someone new to gaming (VR is my first gaming experience) not only is this the most detailed VR I have experienced, it is also the most realistic.  WOW! It was worth every penny and then some.   I couldn't believe how 3 dimentional everything is and how I felt like I really was Batman.  Why can't all VR games be like this!? 

I only have one question? After the Asylum experience, is it complete?   I saw the "Riddles" On or Off, but wasn't sure what to do next. Please help!  Will a Batman game be coming out?  I will be the first one to buy it.
Short but great!

It is more a teaser for Batman than an actual game... The short storie is extremely linear, you have to do one action after another in order to move foward. The graphics are good but I finished the game in 1 hour. 
If this is your first VR experience you might like it otherwise get a real VR game with your $.

This is a decent demo. It is not a game. I felt like this was an experiment in what could be done in VR to move from game to interactive fiction. An excellent step by a major team, but everyone is still trying to figure this new medium out, so there will be bumps.  If you can keep that in mind, and forgive the interface clunkiness, it is a good time.
The experience was absolutely incredible, but I was so disappointed with how short it was! I want a FULL Batman game in the vr experience, it was fantastic! And creepy AFFF.

review_title: Fun but way expensive and super short
one_reviews_text: WHy could they not develop a fuller game.  I would play 40 plus hours of this if i could.  This should only be a demo and should be free. charging people for this should be a crime.  About 20 minutes of game play.  thats a dollar a minute people.  looks beautiful and shows how good VR could be if it wasnt for lazy developers realeasing short as demos and charginf full game prices.
The graphics looks amazing, but I took me only half an hour to finish it. The name is misleading, so basically you are buying a "Demo" without knowing it. Not worth the money.

This would be a very, very good game if it were a proper game and not a demo. It is really polished and interesting, but ends in a few minutes. Other games's free demos (in all platforms, consoles, PC etc) are longer, and free.
the game wont start after working for the first time. Can't get it to work and there is not a decent support for the game

review_title: 5 stars if it was longer.  So worth it
one_reviews_text:
I only gave it Arkham VR 4 out of 5, but it was still one of the greatest gaming experiences of my life, and I'm almost 50.
It's a dream of being Batman, come true.

You're reading this because you spent an INSANE amount of money to be an early adopter of VR, and you did that to play THIS!  The short length of the game is honestly IRRELEVANT, you spent over $1,000 to have VR, do yourself a favor and spend $20 dollars so that you can BE BATMAN!!!  

Now for the game!  I had chills the entire time.  Graphics maxed out (I have GTX 1080 ti) and its the most realistic, beautiful, enthralling experience I have had to date.  After being Rick Grimes in Arizona Sunshine, and Neo in SUPERHOT, I finally got to live out my childhood fantasy of BEING BATMAN!

I would love for these guys to make a ton of money on this short experience and either make a full fledged game on their own, or have Oculus studios throw an insane amount of money at them to make a longer experience.  There's actually a story arc, there are gameplay elements explored that I haven't experienced in other games that are fantastic.  You feel like detective batman, which is my favorite batman.  The experience is phenomenal, and enthralling.  It's also much darker than I had anticipated, which was a pleasant surprise (parents be warned).

There is replay value here as well, collectibles and little secrets to go back and look for, which is a great excuse to spend more time in this beautifully dark world.

Do yourself a favor, treat yourself to this wonderful little gem, and vote with your wallet that this game would be wonderful as a full length experience.  Within mintues you'll find yourself tapping into you're lowest vocal registers and saying "I'm Batman!" ;)  CHEERS!

All I see about this game is that it's short and not really a game, so I was pleasantly surprised. The graphics, envorinments, puzzles, everything is AAA quality.  It is short as hell, even taking my time and really soaking it in, but there's also a large amount of Riddler puzzles.  That sounds bad, but I was actually having a lot of fun trying to solve them.  I think they make the game worth the price.
While i am a batman fan and was thinking this game would be amazing. It is like a demo and not worth the 20$ in my opinion it is worth maybe 5$ and even then it is stretching that 5$ so dont buy it

review_title: Amazing graphic and really really short
one_reviews_text:
PROS:
Graphics are outstanding. max all the setting out and you are in the world of Batman. Hand down the best graphics todate. and in some places so good i stepped back because i thought the joker was in the room for real. 

CONS:
-OMG short. THIS is more of a feeling of teaser status. just when it starts to get good credits roll. but there is bonus section to do the same story over and over and over to find easter eggs and then a match cards to unlock stuff. but its the same story over and over and ......
-You get to pick either car or plane and the screen goes black while you travel in said choice. WTF i cant drive either......
-Weapons = a grapple and CSI gizmo. 
-Some puzzles that are super easy. 
-$22 price tag. i mean come on this is what vr games are becoming? trailers, teasers. am i pissed at paying $22 for a game thats got F all for replay story... YES. i can only hope there is more coming. and free.
-ZERO fight scene you get to use fists, weapons. NOTHING.. you're more of the CSI batman then anything else. of find this bat xray that, grapple to plane you dont get to fly in, just a black screen and lots of cools sounds. Hey Grapple this!!!!
-Movement: just teleport and you dont get to choose they are premarked and very few spots.. no chance to explore the manor, cave nothing. 

this could be a 5/5 star but falls so short on its face. this is such a disapointment.

Over all, you want a exspensive thrill that lasts all of 30 mins. here it is at $22. aand believe me the graphics are just amazing. i will let friends try it just for that but, but at then end it will be the same responce. 

Was that it?!?!


Save your money wait for HUGE sale or update more content.

When i was taken to the opening city screen i was in awe of the graphical style and sense of realism. The sound was immersive and helped to create a sense of really being there. The work and polish that has gone into this game (sound and graphics) really stands above the crowd. The game itself is pretty linear and I couldn't be bothered with some of the frustrating puzzles. I just wanted to see the next location and look around with that feeling of being in another world. Given the work that has gone into the AAA quality, incredible value for money. Plays a bit with the mind though which I'm not keen on. I wonder if developers consider that playing with the mind in this way has the potential to cause lasting distress. Otherwise I would have given it 5 stars. Being able to get to each scene faster would make this game better. I say game because you can interact and play around with things despite the story being linear. Very good.

review_title: To short for its price tag
one_reviews_text: This game is just 1 hour of gameplay. Dont give me that riddler scavenger hunt excuse, Its 1 hour, that's it. But its brilliant, beautiful and highly entertaining. It's FAIR price should be $9.99. Please do not buy this at anything above $9.99. Do not give studios the idea that they can charge anything above 10 dollars for an experience that is shorter than a movie.

review_title: Not what I was hoping for!
one_reviews_text: Very disappointing game despite the very high attention to detail.  It's basically a series of puzzles that I found very boring.
Cool game. Really makes you feel like batman.
first time i have paid for a demo. (i paid for it thinking it was a game; wrong) has promise if they actually had real VR game developers and not the laziest and cheapest they could find.
i just bought this yesterdayand after re installing it 3 times,batman vr still keeps crashing and wont let me even get to the main menu. please fix!

review_title: Read this = there is more value
one_reviews_text:
First off, I am writing this review on 5/4/2017 - "May the fourth be with you" date.  There is a reason - the joker could easily say "May the Force be with you" (a sharp eyed reader will know why in the credits!).
This game shows the potential and future of VR - it is stunning.  Yes, it is short but people are forgetting there is another experience after finishing the game by solving all of the Riddler's puzzles.  Once you solve a riddle/puzzle, you either unlock a character or vehicle which is very cool!  So overall there is more playability here than what others state.  Graphics are superb, - don't forget to go into options and turn up the pixel density.  Oh, and an undocumented feature: place your hand up next to your head and press the grab button - it zooms in to whatever you're looking at. Kinda cool albeit provides no functionality in the game... 
And lastly, I'll give you a more detailed clue why there is a huge Star Wars connection here...look at the credits and pay attention to  who voices the Joker in this game ;-)
A recommended buy for $20 and it ensures future development for a full length experience!

I don't really have an issue paying like $20 for a portion of a AAA game. This being said, it IS what it feels like, a portion of a game. Being that most AAA games are around $60, I feel like if they throw out expansions fast, before we all feel soured on it, they can save the game. I ALSO would love the option to see a driving/flying screen while Im loading rather than pitch black.  So ...ya...I needa be Batman summore.

review_title: Amazing but to short for price
one_reviews_text: So like everyone else is saying this really is amazing and rocksteady did a fantastic job and it's one of those games / experiences you need to have in your VR library, BUT 14.99 is a bit much for how short it is. It kinda feels like playing a big demo of an upcoming game but sadly its not a demo. So to sum up it's amazing and a must try but its not a big game and the price is abit much for the length
Its not clear youre paying $20 for a demo.  A nice demo, but come on!!

review_title: Beautiful and as short as a demo
one_reviews_text: The graphics quality was top notch. The scenes are beautiful and cinematic. The game length is like one hour. When the credits started rolling, I thought I completed a prologue and the real game was about to start, I kid you not. Joke's on me.

Remember - Always be yourself....unless you can be Batman, then you should always be Batman.

Awesome graphics/models and story, hopefully a sign of more to come...please! Plenty to go back and do after you finish the 'main' story with all the Joker stuff. I need me some of that 60's Batmobile action.
So many awesome Batmobile models - be such a waste to not use them for a full story,
I am throwing my wallet at the screen but nothing is happening...

review_title: We all know what to expect at this point
one_reviews_text: At this point, we all know this is a glorified demo. It is $20USD for about an hour of entertainment. If you are like me, you can share that entertainment with your kids or a friend. Much worst ways to spend $20. Cool way to show off VR but, so is Google Earth. Depends what you like. For Batman fans, it is worth $20 to be him for an hour and to see the Batcave for a bit.

I think Oculus needs to get involved here and govern the cost of these games based on the actual game play. This game was amazing, but it was SOOOO short. Not worth $20. It was a short experience, likely worth $10.
Even though it is short, I will still give this 5 stars. The graphics were amazing and I was totally immersed. Well done. Please bring us more. That ending was amazing.
While all the graphics etc are amazing, it's pretty underwhelming considering the shortness of the game. Way too short for $20.

One of the best looking games for VR so far, shows the potential that VR can look as good as monitor games! Unfortunately its just a short episode with very limited gameplay, would love to see more devs!!!

Pros: This graphics are amazing! The sounds, character models,  and overall feeling you get while playing are really great! You can play through muliple times to unlock hidden items.

Cons: Very short. When the credits rolled, I was expectating a whole bunch more. 

Summary: They put great work into creating the start of this game. Now they just need to add a few more hours of game play.

This is a very good showcase to show fans of batman or just VR in general, but if you're looking for a good valued VR game, this isn't it. I'm perfectly contempt paying $23 for this as I know a lot of work went into it, but it's too short for me to give it a 5* rating. Perhaps if there are free expansions then I'll review this rating. If you enjoy VR and don't mind short length games (about an hour), then this is very much worth it.

DC,WB,Rocksteady, what more could anyone ask for when involving VR. This game is really short but comfortable experience. i was looking forward to how this was going to end. but now i really wish it didn't end that way, what happen to batman or did the jokers death make him crazy? if i had any requests catwoman model because she's awesome. poison ivy model & new act or combat simulation that has slow motion matrix style when breaking bones. also blocking with grabs be really sweet. I recommend this game! P.s you could also make the radio scanner give repeatable police missions.

superb, bang on, been waiting for a game like this. it really works with vr and graphics are brill....most vr games are not up to scratch but this is really worth getting and worth the price (keep up the hard work) and ask for other developers.....take note 10/10

P.S. Game NEEEEEEEDS to be longer though, only let down :)
CANT FLY OR DRIVE  FOR $ 20 DOLLARS DONT RECOMMENT TO ANYONE TO BUY THIS DEMO

That was really great!  I could have played a full batman game like that.  As it is, this is just the opening act of a game.  Would need to be at least 5 times larger to really be a full game so to speak.  If I think of this as an opening chapter to something, it was amazing!

review_title: Dark, linear, 'I expect you to die'
one_reviews_text: Yes the actual story is short. This is a batman themed VR puzzle game at the end of the day. Be prepared to go on an easter egg hunt after you finish the game to get the most out of it. If you like Batman for more than the Arkham games, you should enjoy this: just don't expect a full game here. Quality proof of concept. Hopefully a hint of what is to come.

Absolutely loved it. I would pay $19.99 just to experience this one time. No, it's not a traditional console type game, but the graphics and detail are outrageous. The story is amazing. Rocksteady hits it out of the park, again. I played it for about 5 hours straight last night. There is plenty of content for the money, and this is a VR graphical, immersive experience that is second to none.
Should have been free, this feels like a tech demo. Way to short to be called a game for the price they are asking.

But beautifully made. many new mechanics that only work in vr. The suiting up sequence is worth the price of admission on its own. Not to mention batarangs and targeting crims by sight and and and....
More please

review_title: This was an excellent experience, but...
one_reviews_text:
I'll start with the negatives. Specific location teleportation is getting old. I play too many games where I'm completely free to move around to be stuck to one location anymore, especially if I'm Batman. The transition blackout scenes made me sad. I thought I was going to get to drive/pilot a bat-vehicle and all I got was some noise and controller vibe. I really really just hoped it was my graphics card going out or something. It was WAAAAY too short. I've never played a game before that I was enjoying so much that I felt majorly disappointed when I realized it was over. It should have been at least two to three times longer, or half the price.

Now, I'm not a huge Batman fan, but after watching the preview, I definitely wanted to be Batman. Getting to suit up as Batman and
play with some of his toys was pretty awesome. The levels were well done and the characters weren't too bad. The whole thing put together looked pretty great. The story and puzzled moved along pretty well. There wasn't anything difficult or that took too much thinking. The controls were pretty intuitive and there was a fair amount of things to manipulate and although you had to jump from point to point, there was still usually enough freedom that it almost felt as though you could start walking around. There were a couple things that happened in the game that you just can't do as effectively outside of VR. That was pretty amazing. I really felt like I was melding into the character.

It definitely left me wanting more and I think that's what frustrates me about the price. I was expecting it to be longer. When I got to the end, I REALLY wanted it to be longer! I wanted more freedom as Batman. As it is, my family had to put up with a few days of me saying "I'm Batman." If it was 3 times as long, I'm sure my co-workers would hate me by now. I really hope this gets worked on more. It was one of my favorite VR experiences.

review_title: Very good, but too short and expensive!
one_reviews_text: Honestly, if the game was not so short or not so expensive, it would have been a 5 stars. It was my first VR games and I was totally impressed by how we could feel beeing in a world like that. The first sequence is awesome and some of the investigations really cool. The characters we meet and the way they move or talk to you is impressive. But let's be honest, 20$ is a shame, I bought Wilson's heart  45$ and it lasts much much longer, more immersive and so much more gameplay, puzzle or boss fights. Those 2 games are very similar but I can't stop playing Wilson's heart,  and do you know why ? Because it's longer than a demo!! : )

I firstly bought it on steam... Same experience but laggy to death ... even with my conf ... Refund and then bought in oculus store ... And this time,No problems ... It is a F***ing Great Experience as every Rocksteady studio productions ... but more an introduction than a full game ... with just an hour of gameplay ... it is Just NOT ENOUGH !!! Give Us more !!! (Joker's insane Laugh !!!)

Any fan of Batman will love this game.  The first time that you ascend down into the batcave is absolutely amazing!  Graphics, sound, characters, and immersion are great.  Just wish this game were way longer!  It goes by so quick, because  you really enjoy it.  Batman with 10+ hours of gameplay would be insanely good.

Was so looking forward to this one, who doesnt want to be Batman? Loved all the previous Batman games and enjoyed this one too. However its not really a game more of a demo, take the VR away from this and no one would pay money for it. Its the sort of thing you would expect to get for free as a normal pc game demo. I cannot really recommend this one at its current price as a VR experience i would wait till it comes down to £4.99. Also it doesnt really make you feel like Batman from the previous games as there is no combat in it, you dont get to drive any of the vehicles, you just do a couple of the simple crime scene scanning elements you have seen in the other games in the series. In addition although i dont mind teleporting in VR games, as its better than feeling sick, this game only has node based teleporting - the same thing everyone is complaining about in Wilson's Heart.

review_title: Yep $30 AUD for less than an hour.
one_reviews_text: Pick a few things up and look at them, fake grapple around a set path, solve a few environment puzzles, some nice character models and set design over what is an hour or so, all for the low low price of 30 bucks, nearly half the price of a triple A game and one fiftieth of the length. But you can look in the mirror and check yourself out as Batman! This should be a couple of bucks or free. You know that first hour in most games where they teach you how to play the game in a psuedo tutorial? Well that's this, but without the rest of the game attached stinking up the place. Something for people with really really really really short attention spans.
After Robo Recall i think this is a good example of what VR will be, but very short. I want more, i'm Batman.

I don´t mind this game being short and restricted. Since I bought my Rift half a year ago I am again and again blown away by the experience. This is one of the strongest so far. Some parts are almost frighteningly realistic and I had so many visions about how games could be in the future (if we keep on supporting VR). Actually it wouldn´t take so much to make a full game out of this. It will be some years until we can explore Gotham without restrictions, but I definitely want to be part of every step in that direction. Take my money!

As a batman fan I found this VR game graphics,music and controls are spot on however the game is very short that gives the impression that its incomplete and to ask for 14.99 pounds is a rip off .. the only way that WB makes up for batman fans is to either release a DLC to expand the game or bring the price for this game down.

If purchasing this helps get a full game developed, then it was money well spent. This is a polished, immersive (but very short) experience which really shows the potential of VR. Great graphics and game machanics; it's Batman CSI over the brawler version on consoles, but its perfect for VR. I just want more of it. Minus one star due its lenght
This gane was really fun, but also really short. I did not think it was a "demo" at first.

review_title: Much to expensive! Only 1 hour fun!
one_reviews_text: Its only a Demo and not a real Game. After about 30 Minutes you are at the End.

Way to short, but is everything we want and we want more! Feels like the beginning of a great game. Almost like going to Six-Flags theme park and riding the batman ride, except the ride is over way to fast! Price is right for the content. I hope they expand soon :-)
But less play thing you can do not like a game more like a VR exp.

Good graphics. Nice gameplay. Good standing up perspective.
Now it needs to be updated to add the full game!

Even is it really short = 40-60 minutes of gameplay, I would buy this game always again. If you are a Batman/DC Fan, u HAVE to buy it really no joke. Of course no fighting scene but this ending is nearly worth 30€ so ... who cares

I was very excited to enter the world of Batman. However, I never got to enter the world. Very disappointed! Although it looked very nice, the game ended in roughly one hour and credits rolled. Son of a...

review_title: It's really cool but WAY too short
one_reviews_text: It's really fun, but WAY too short to be worth the money. They should extend the content or bring down the price a bit.

review_title: A great experience, but a tad short...
one_reviews_text: Batman Arkham VR is a fantastic experience and a must play for any Batman fan.  Being Batman for an hour was a ton of fun.  I wish there was more, but I don't regret spending $20 for such a polished experience.

This game has raised the bar way up for VR! The graphics are simply amazing! I love this Batman experience, and hated to see it end. Please developers, don't tease us like this with such a short experience. We want more!
If it crashes on load, install http://download.microsoft.com/download/9/E/C/9EC0EC2C-8151-468A-95A3-2F2AD6A2AC13/Microsoft-Windows-MediaFeaturePack-OOB-Package.msu

review_title: No fight No drive No Depth
one_reviews_text: Oh sure hands down graphics but thats it. A little bit of mystery solving. Simple. Hardly a plot. No fighting and a awesome looking vehicles for a tease to do nothing with. Its not that stimulating and I feel I have lost the whole $29.99.
This has amazing production value and graphics, and some very original VR mechanics. I wouldn't mind that it's so short if it was priced accordingly. Worth $20? No.  Worth $15? Yes.
JUST THE BEST THING EVER!
I was so into this game, I have to say I was disappointed to find such a quick ending. For $19.99 I think I got my money's worth for sure. Great job rocksteady!
Very short as everyone has pointed out but really an excellent experience for showing off your Rift.Worth the price to have this gem in my library.

45 min of play...... sad
good demo
Visually great. But no where near it being worthy of the price tag. Save yourself $20 and 30mins of game play.
I enjoyed this game from the start.. Great example of what VR is capable of... My only issue is that it is far to short, should be priced closer to 7-8 bucks but still a great title..
the experience is completely on rails but it is entertaining as long as you don't take it too seriously
The "game" was pretty cool but only an hour worth of play? Come on. You seriously employed all of those people in the credits for an hour worth of game?
Awesome game, my only complaint is the length... I wanted more Batman. Visuals are incredible, and design is outstanding. A brilliant VR experience.
Slightly too expensive for such a short gameplay. I hope they will provide free updates to it as at the present it is a ripoff IMHO

review_title: Facebook Should fire the Oculus Team!
one_reviews_text: Rift is the worst product that hit the market! Playstation VR and Vib VR has this piece of crap Oculus Rift beat! No support, refresh rate is crap causing one to be dizzy after a few minutes and your so called "games" are overall crap! Mark (CEO) of Facebook/Oculus - It would be nice if you actually took pride in the products you purchase from people. You got so big as a company, that the money went to your heads and pockets instead of the things you invest in that people like me made a mistake purchasing! I'm selling this piece of crap and moving to a Vib or Playstation VR!  You should learn from these guys, they actually put time and effort into the products they create!
Even though the story is short as everyone said, this is the whole new level of VR experience I have ever had. Great job making this. I can't wait for more to come!!
well worth it just to see the high quality character art
absolutely fantasic, well worth playing
This is a great EXPERIENCE! This is by no means a "game", but it is an amazing VR experience. Easily worth the $20 just to be The Batman!
to short!

review_title: You are the BATMAN, for a short time.
one_reviews_text: It's trully amazing game. Incredible amount of details but really short. Gave it a 5 stars only becouse I'am a huge fan of ROCKSTEADY's BATMAN. Want more!!!
Great graphics... Weak gameplay...
the game is so cool for 1 hour
Loved this game. It is short like the other reviews say but it is very very good. is it worth the $20? completly depends on how much you like batman.
For the price, it's long enough. One the best.
Best graphics and immersion of all Vr title in the market.

review_title: BEST GAME!!! Worth the money!!! But...
one_reviews_text: I LOVE this game, but it is too short. It is a real game with real story, just like a normal videogame. You have to make more!
Loving the game so far.....
One of the most polished VR experiences to date.
smooth! much fun! and I got scared..... QQ
A good exemple of what VR can do best but....way too short for the price
very well done
Boss experience, lets keep up the anti for further content ..... worth it.

review_title: more of an experience than a game but wo
one_reviews_text: very happy for the money a good way to demonstrate vr to new people

review_title: *** a w e s o m e ! ! ! ***
one_reviews_text: this will be my new "show off VR" game. amazing...everything!
This is basically a demo for $20.
There for not worth 19$
